TUESDAY, MARCH 25, 1969
CORPORATION FOR PUBLIC BROADCASTING
TO EXAMINE PUBLIC BROADCASTING
IN CONTINUING EDUCATION
New York, March 24 - The contribution that public radio
and television broadcasting can make in expanding educational
opportunity for the nation's adults is the central concern
of a special study being undertaken for the Corporation
for Public Broadcasting, John W. Macy, Jr., CPB President,
announced today. The study, to be completed in early
September, will be conducted for the Corporation by the
National Instructional Television Center CNITC).
